engagement_grid._comment: G1: Who was engaged and how

engagement_descriptions.barriers_people_who_use_drugs: The City of Amesbury has not allocated any opioid funding at this time and is still in the planning phase. It is our intention to allow our settlement funding to accumulate, so that we may combine it with other funding sources and create a Division of Public Wellness. Some of the funding sources we have identified are regional and age specific, resulting in a Division that serves all age groups and populations as well as neighboring municipalities.

behavioral_health_assessment._comment: G3: How behavioral health needs were assessed

planning.process: We did not engage in a planning process.

additional_comments.general: The City is currently planning to reorganize the current structure of our Health Department, removing it from the purview of Inspectional Services. We are seeking to create a division for Public Wellness using funding from the following sources: Opioids Settlement funding, Behavioral Health Outreach for Aging Population grant (BHOAP), Public Health Excellence grant (PHE), and Drug Free Communities (DFC) grant currently administered by Partnership of Amesbury Community & Teens (PACT). This new division would be created by an Administrative Order from the Mayor, and the official name has not yet been determined.
